intro: Prunus triloba var. plena, commonly known as the double-flowered Amur cherry, is a cultivar of the Amur cherry tree. It is characterized by its dense, double blossoms that appear in early spring, giving it a lush, almost floral appearance. The plant is native to eastern Asia and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Its foliage is dark green and provides a striking contrast to the showy flowers. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a versatile choice for temperate climates.
